author: haynau
title: Best Brickmaster book so far!
review:
Good value (lots of bricks, some neat special ones) for your money, a really cool-looking cop (the thief/bankrobber is just the average one you get in about every police set).

 

The smaller vehicles you can build using this set are more or less good designed (rear part of the "bubble-top-policecar" looks quite empty, the small airplane is a bit too wide at front - but the rest is fine!). The four "bigger" models are an eyecatcher: the bank-safe looks very well, occassionally the door comes off when you try to open it. The police car looks almost better than the ones in the City-police-sets. The black sports car is far better than anything designed among cars in the last few years.

 

The best part is the small chopper - I could very well imagine it in a stand-alone set. It is perfectly designed, achieves to present a cool model by using a relatively small amount of bricks.

 

A "must-have" if you are looking for a present for a kid - but also if you are an AFOL, there are quite a number of special bricks to get in this one.

author: tkettle9719
title: The Chase Begins...
review:
I got this set a few days ago as a gift for my younger cousin on Christmas. However, after learning that he had sets that he hadn't gotten around to building yet, my family decided  to get him something else. However, so as not to enter the evil lines of Customer Service a few days after Christmas, I decided to take it. Even though I never really wanted this, I still think that it's a very nice set for anyone to have.

Pros

  • The Getaway Car, which has 55 pieces with the minifigure included, is sleek and very correctly colored. It's not complex, but it looks awesome.
  • The Police helicopter, 47 pieces, manages to make a nice little search vehicle, and the pieces are perfect together.
  • The main vehicles shown on the cover have a ton of playability together, and both have the nice swoosh factor (the car can have swoosh-iness too).

Cons

  • The exclusion of doors on the Getaway Car is a bit of a letdown since there are doors on the Police Car.
  • The helicopter is small and cramped; it's nice for kids, but adults will not be pleased by the miniature helicopter/
  • There are pieces which appear in one model, and it sort of dissappoints me that these couldn't be integrated into the other set of models.

The Brickmaster City book is a nice gift which allows people to go do what they want with a set amount of pieces. Complete with inspiration models and full instructions for two sets of two models each, this is a nice gift for children. I would recommend this if it were on sale.
